Academics

Shanghai American School (Puxi Campus) 2016-2023 | Middle School - High School (Grades 6-12)

I have been a student at Shanghai American School since 6th grade, and currently I am a senior. Some of the advanced courses I have taken as a high-schooler include AP United States History, AP Physics 1, AP Language and Composition, AP Psychology, and IB Chinese Mandarin B HL.

Involved in many school clubs such as Computer Science club, Robotics club, Make a Child Smile club and more. First joined the SAS high school JV baseball team in 9th grade, I also participated in the JV badminton team for a year in 10th grade.

Shanghai Fudan Wanke Experimental Private School (International Division) 2010-2015 | Elementary School (Grades 1-5)

Although this is a local Shanghai private school, I was participating under the international division where all classes except Math and Chinese were taught in English.

Some of my favorite activites include the yearly spelling bee and speech competitions, in which I have won multiple awards each year.

Due to a sudden illness that brought me on a world-wide journey for a diagnosis, I did not attend the first semester of 5th grade here.

E.H. Greene Intermediate School 2015 | Elementary School (First Semester of 5th Grade)

While I was receiving treatment in Cincinnati for my illness CRMO (Chronic recurrent multifocal osteomyelitis) I attended the local public elementary school to not drop my academics.

I was a new student and one of the few Asians, while also being on crutches due to having a hole in my leg from a bone marrow biopsy. Despite short lasting, I made some great friends here that helped make my experience much more pleasant. Here I also got to interact with a much more diverse student body, leanring more about what life is like outside of China.

The following semester I returned back to the Fudan Wanke School in Shanghai as I was almost fully recovered.

Stars and Stripes American Kindergarten 2006-2009 | All American Kindergarten

Not much is remebered about my kindergarten experience

High School Experiences


11th Grade

HIE Flow Company Website Development

Hosted by HIE Flow Company
  • Learning the backend server used to host website

  • Planning the layout and structure of the website

  • Collaboration with company marketing team to gather information about company for display

  • Gathering of images of products and company logos

  • Revision of banners and interactivity of website

  • Organize products into smart categories

  • Programming to display product details and advantages

  • Responsive Design
    • 11th Grade

    Understanding Blockchain, AI, & Machine Learning

    Hosted by Columbia University
  • Explore artificial intelligence and machine learning

  • Understanding philosophical and ethical issues, relationship with consciousness and self-awareness

  • Exploring categories and applications of AI algorithms, challenges, and opportunities in future

  • Learning what blockchain is, how it has evolved, and where it is headed

  • Evaluating impacts of these technologies on society and how to become leaders shaping these fields

    • 11th Grade

    English Corner Call (Tutoring)

  • Organized and led English tutoring calls, first with Chinese adults and later with local Chinese students

  • Calls explored and discussed different current topics in the world

  • Sharing of favorite books/movies, exploring themes of life and more

  • Sharing English tips, expanding vocabulary, and practice effective phrasing of thoughts so that students can better express and convey themselves

    • 10-11th Grade

    Heart to Heart Shanghai (H2H) Volunteering

  • H2H is a non-profit organization that provides support for rural Chinese families, we also sponsor for children's congenital heart disease surgery

  • Worked with H2H management team to sort and package donated goods, while also planning on future events

  • Worked with H2H events team, standing booths across Shanghai during weekends. I helped with raising awarness, introducing our organization, gathering more volunteers, and most importantly helped fundraise. Which involves selling of Heart Bears — teddy bears wearing clothing hand sewn by volunteers

  • Volunteered at H2H playroom, interacting and playing with sponsored children post heart surgery in the hospital playrooms, with the goals of speeding up recovery from surgery

    • 9-12th Grade

    SAS JV Baseball Team

  • Participation in my school's yearly JV baseball team

  • Each season lasts for 2 months, involving afterschool practice commitments, and frequent games/scrimmages with other schools.

  • In 9th grade I also participated in the China Cup, however due to COVID, games were limited in 10-11th grade

    • 9-12th Grade

    SAS Clubs

      Computer Science Club

    • Creation, learning, and problem solving with computer science
    • Meaningfully apply comp sci in collaboration with other members on real-world projects
    • Understanding of new and rising technologies such as AI and Machine learning.
    • Exploration of web development

      Make a Child Smile Service Club

    • Helped raise money to employ a teacher at the Chinese orphanage
    • Funding for the Huixin Education Fund, which allows young children behind in their education to get caught up to their grade levels, enabling them to enroll in school
    • As students we also host many activities with the children at the Huixin Orphanage such as writing and sending cards, hosting special christmas/halloween events, and more

      Robotics Club

    • Collaborating in group settings to design, develop, build, document, and program robots that can compete in different challenges hosted by schools
    • Weekly afterschool commitments to meetings

    My Portfolio

    HIE (Shanghai) Flow Technology Corp. Professional Website

    Cooperating with the company, I helped develop this website for the company HIE Flow as their main website for displaying products.

    Details













    HIE (Shanghai) Flow Technology Corp. Website

    design / development

    Link to website:
    Link

    Website URL: http://hieflow.com (Or click link above)

    After self-learning web development and the creation of this resume website, I was offered an internship opportunity at the company HIE (Shanghai) Flow Technology Corp. to help in assisting with the creation of the company's professional website that helps display products and introduce the company.

    This project utilizes front end development through HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. Also requiring certain backend development such as PHP and the using of the backend developing platform and tools such as FTP. This is a gallery (collection) of both snapshots of the website and the backend platform programming.
